focus.title: Sustained Attention
focus.description: Maintaining a high click rate requires extreme mental concentration. Maintaining consistency for 10s or 30s is an excellent workout for sustained attention.

neural.title: Neural-Motor Connection
neural.description: Strengthens the signal transmission between brain and fingers. Rapid reaction is a result of the brain sending fast command signals and efficient neural pathways.

flow.title: Flow State & Relief
flow.description: Rhythmic high-speed clicking can help induce a 'flow state', clearing the mind of clutter. It acts as a unique stress reliever and brain reset.

focus.question: Is this just about hand speed?
focus.answer: Not entirely. To reach limits (like 10+ CPS) and stay consistent, your brain must be highly focused to control micro-movements. Any momentary distraction drops your speed, making this a test of high-intensity short-term focus.

warmup.question: Is this a good brain warmup?
warmup.answer: Yes. Short bursts of clicking (like the 5s mode) quickly activate the nervous system and wake up the cerebral cortex, helping you transition from a groggy state to a ready-to-work state.

improve.question: How to improve my score?
improve.answer: Besides clicking techniques, the key is breathing and relaxing your arm muscles. Tension leads to stiffness. Learning 'relaxed focus' is key to high performance‚Äîa great mindfulness practice in itself.

health.question: Can high-speed clicking cause injury?
health.answer: Yes, prolonged repetition can cause fatigue. Please practice moderately (we recommend sets under 30s) and stop immediately if you feel pain. This is designed for burst training, not endurance marathons.
